intro: Ciconium inquinans, commonly known as the dirty ciconium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
